contentrichtext.text: '''Raffles''' may refer to: ==People== *[[Sir]] [[Stamford Raffles]] (1781â€“1826), a British statesman, Lieutenant Governor of Java and founder of Singapore in 1819. ==Schools== *[[Raffles College of Design and Commerce]], a private education provider in Sydney, Australia *[[Raffles Girls' Primary School]], an all-girls primary school in Singapore *[[Raffles Girls' School (Secondary)]], an all-girls secondary school in Singapore *[[Raffles Institution (Secondary)]], the all-boys secondary section of the oldest school in Singapore *[[Raffles Institution (Junior College)]], the junior college section of the oldest school in Singapore *[[National University of Singapore]], which used to be called Raffles College *[[Raffles International Christian School]], a school in Indonesia ==Business== *[[Raffles City]], a shopping mall in Singapore *The [[Raffles Hotel]] in Singapore, named after Stamford Raffles *[[Fairmont Raffles Hotels International|Raffles International]], a chain of hotels, owner of the Raffles Hotel *[[Raffles (cigarette)]], a cigarette brand made by [[Philip Morris International|Philip Morris]] ==Fiction== *[[A. J. Raffles]], a fictional gentleman thief in a series of books by E. W. Hornung **''[[Raffles, the Amateur Cracksman]]'', silent film of original stage play starring John Barrymore **[[Raffles (1925 film)|''Raffles'' (1925 film)]], a silent adaptation starring [[House Peters]] **[[Raffles (1930 film)|''Raffles'' (1930 film)]], a sound adaption starring Ronald Colman **''[[The Return of Raffles]]'', a 1933 film starring George Barraud **[[Raffles (1939 film)|''Raffles'' (1939 film)]], another adaptation, starring David Niven **[[Raffles (TV series)|''Raffles'' (TV series)]] a 1977 television adaptation starring Anthony Valentine **''[[Raffles, Gentleman Thug]]'', a comic strip and its main character, a parody of A. J. Raffles *[[Raffles (Lord Lister)]], a fictional German pulp hero originally with similarities to A. J. Raffles * [[The Doings of Raffles Haw|Raffles Haw]], a fictional character in a moralistic story by A. Conan Doyle * ''Raffles Hotel'', a book by [[Ryu Murakami]] that takes place in the Raffles Hotel * "Raffles", an episode of the British sitcom ''[[List of Hi-de-Hi! episodes#Ep39|Hi-de-Hi!]]'' ==Geography== * [[Raffles, Cumbria]], a suburb of Carlisle, United Kingdom * [[Raffles Bay]], Northern Territory, Australia ==Other uses== *The [[Raffles Museum#Major research facilities|Raffles Museum of Biodiversity Research]] at the National University of Singapore *The plural of [[raffle]], a game of chance involving numbered tickets *[[Raffles (horse)]], a famous Arabian horse stallion *[[Rafflesia arnoldii]], a plant species named after Raffles {{disambiguation}}
